== Introduction ==
Ubuntu includes some powerful tools for managing software. Here are some of those tools and terminology:

=== The Basics ===

* <nowiki>[[InstallingSoftware| Installing Software]]</nowiki> - Find out how to install software.
* <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SynapticHowto#Adding%20or%20Removing%20Software| Removing Software]]</nowiki> - Find out how to remove software.

* <nowiki>[[SoftwarePackagingFormats| Software Packaging Formats]]</nowiki> - Linux programs come packaged in a number of different ways. This is an overview of them.

* <nowiki>[[Repositories]]</nowiki> increase the number of packages available to install on your system.
** <nowiki>[[Repositories-Ubuntu| Managing Repositories in Ubuntu]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[Repositories-Kubuntu| Managing Repositories in Kubuntu]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SwitchingToUbuntu| Switching To Ubuntu]]</nowiki> - Learn how Ubuntu compares to your current operating system.
** <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SwitchingToUbuntuFromWindows#Installing%20Applications | Windows]]</nowiki> - How installing software works in Ubuntu compared to Microsoft Windows
** <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SwitchingToUbuntu/FromMacOSX#Installing%20Software | Mac OSX]]</nowiki> - How installing software works in Ubuntu compared to Apple OSX

=== On The Command Line ===

* <nowiki>[[AptGetHowTo| Using apt-get]]</nowiki> - How to use apt-get for package management.

* <nowiki>[[AptitudeSurvivalGuide| Using Aptitude]]</nowiki> - How to use aptitude for package management.

* <nowiki>[[CommandLinePackageManagement| Commandline Package Management Tools]]</nowiki> - Overview of the various command line package management tools.

* <nowiki>[[Repositories-CommandLine| Commandline Repository Management Tools]]</nowiki> - Managing Repositories from the command line.

* <nowiki>[[Tasksel]]</nowiki> -  Packages for various tasks can be installed using tasksel.
 
* <nowiki>[[Configuration]]</nowiki> - Manage configuration files after a new Ubuntu release installation. 

=== On Web-browser ===

* http://appnr.com/ - Web-based package browser. (Currently works only in Firefox)

=== Further Topics ===

* <nowiki>[[InstallingRunPackage|Installing .run Packages]]</nowiki> - Installing software packages (typically games) which use ''.run'' installer files.
* <nowiki>[[ReinstallingSamePackages| Reinstalling same packages]]</nowiki> - How to install the same packages after a reinstallation of your system.
* <nowiki>[[PhasedUpdates|What are phased updates?]]</nowiki> - An explanation of what phased updates are, how they work in Ubuntu, and how they affect Ubuntu's users.
